description: simMACT (simulation of Maximal ACtuation Torques) is a software library resulting from research carried out by INRS and Inria-AUCTUS. This work concerns the estimation of human physical performance for the design of work equipment. The aim of simMACT is to improve some simulation features of a digital mannequin software (Digital Human Model, DHM), namely the computation of joint actuation torques. It relies on an advanced biomechanical model.
